name: Hyatt Regency Jersey City

reviews.text: I had a short business trip to Jersey City and stayed at the Hyatt through my company travel agency. My office is only about a block away from the hotel, so it was incredibly convenient. We also have an office across the river in New York and the train is right next door...also very convenient.
reviews.title: Clean, good service, convenient

likes.disliked: — Room could've been a little cleaner

reviews.text: The room was very spacious with a king-size bed, nice bathroom, desk area with Internet access and incredible view with an oversized plateglass window. I used room service quite a bit and the food was very good, but expensive. I paid approximiately $30 for oatmeal, a muffin and coffee. They were definitely New York prices.
reviews.title: Loved the comfy beds and the view!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was pricey all around including the nightly rate and excessive room taxes. But, it is the New York metro and I think the price is right in line with other better hotels in the area.
reviews.title: Go for the View !

likes.liked: — clean fresh smells on corridors, stairways, bedrooms, lifts etc
likes.disliked: — Price of bottled water in room and at hotel shop!

reviews.text: Most notably, the service was exceptional. From the moment I checked in, all of the staff went out of their way to make me feel comfortable. I've stayed in a lot of hotels all over the world and the staff at the Hyatt is really exceptional.
reviews.title: Amazing!

reviews.text: For a business traveler or for visiting New York, this hotel is a good bet.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, good stay

reviews.text: This hotel is fantastic ,staff is excellent.Rooms are large beautiful and clean ..the bar area is great saw wonderful fireworks show as we had drinks ..gorgeous view .. Staff is very accommodating ...coffee to go ,.We will happy return to this Hyatt Regency .
reviews.title: View and beyond

reviews.text: We recently stayed at the Hyatt Jersey city for a wedding. The location is excellent. A short subway ride, and you are in lower Manhattan. Great views of the Manhattan skyline, and of the Statue of Liberty. There is not much to do in Jersey City. Not many restaurants within walking distance.
reviews.title: Great location, not up to Hyatt standards

reviews.text: The rooms are just average. Bathrooms are a little on the small sides, and the rooms themselves are not very spacious. Our room was missing Shampoo, though that may have been an anomaly. We found the staff at the lobby a little chilly. It was hot when we were there, and that may ahjave been an issue, but the air conditioning was not working properly. The breakfast buffet is very good, but at $24.00 per person, one would expect it to be.
reviews.title: World Class Service

reviews.text: Overall, a good location, but otherwise, nothing special.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel, Awesome Location, Ronnie's the best!!!

reviews.text: Good location, convenient to get to PATH train or NY Waterway Ferry – minutes away from NYC downtown.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text: I'm looking out the window at my view of the Statue of Liberty enjoying the complimentary chocolate chip cookies and milk (Hyatt Platinum status has its privileges...) thinking, "What could be better?" The answer was sunset overlooking the Manhattan skyline from the on-site restaurant.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was very friendly and went out of their way to exchange pleasantries. The pool was a nice surprise - fairly large and not crowded. There were plenty of people using the workout facilities adjacent to the pool room.
reviews.title: Excellent Staff & Service!

reviews.text: We honestly chose this location because I didn't want to drive into NYC and thought it would be easier to get in/out from Jersey from Philly to Boston. As it turns out, the easiest way to get to Boston is still by driving through the city! But, traffic was pretty easy on Saturday morning.
reviews.title: Outstanding Views, Friendly Staff

reviews.text: We appreciated the PATH train adjacent to the hotel (easy trip to the World Trade Center area of NYC). I'm not sure what there is to do in historic Jersey City, but I'm pretty sure you can get to all the hot spots by foot from this hotel.
reviews.title: nice view of NYC!

reviews.text: If I had to find a fault - it would be the parking. Valet parking is $32, but self-park is advertised as $25. When I went to the nearest parking garage, I learned it was $30 per day. Frankly, I just don't like to use valet parking, but guests are obviously better off using that service.
reviews.title: Everything you need
Spectacular
reviews.text: Very nice room, awesome breakfast, great gym, clean bathroom, over price, but a SPECTACULAR view of Manhattan, right next to the train o 10min from NYC, I recommand but try to deal price. My Harley was safely parked, thank you

I stayed at the Hyatt Jersey City for my best friends wedding. The location is excellent. The Path station is just outside of the property. The views of the Manhattan skyline are beautiful. The hotel is located near lot of corporate companies but there is not much to do in Jersey City.
reviews.title: Beautiful Property and Stunning Views of NYC and Hudson Riveer

reviews.text: The rooms were spacious! We found the staff at the lobby to be very friendly. The breakfast buffet is very good,
reviews.title: What else but Excellent!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wonderful location, great service, and super fun wedding.
reviews.title: Awesome views, superb location, excellent hotel!

reviews.text: I loved the place. The rooms were big, clean. Had an excellent view of Manhattan, from my window. But then, with Hyatt, you can't expect anything else. The Wifi Coverage was good everywhere. Last but not the least, the location is a big plus. Shall certainly visit again
reviews.title: Upgraded to Hudson River Suite - fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited NYC for 5 days and stayed here all 5 nights. The location was great, we found the PATH train to be a very convenient way to access the city quickly. There are a few restaurants and shops in the area, although their hours varied as it is the financial district of Jersey City. This is a great place to stay if you are looking for cleanliness, a great view, and a decent-sized room. Staying in a comparable hotel in Manhattan would easily cost 3-4 times as much.
reviews.title: great value for the money, small issues were resolved by staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was great to us - they let us check in very early and gave us an upgrade to a business class room as we were celebrating our anniversary. They also sent a complimentary fruit plate to our room later in the day.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

likes.disliked: — It's expensive to get a cab into Manhatton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A few minor issues to report: The gift shop was not open during the hours stated in the room's brochure. And beware, they will charge you 75 cents for a 41 cent postage stamp! When we checked into our room there were still items in our refrigerator leftover from the previous guests. We notified the staff and they politely removed them. Coffee, tea, paper cups and glasses were not refilled daily the staff politely refilled them every time we asked.
reviews.title: Slightly disappointed

likes.liked: — the fact we got a free night from our credit card points
likes.disliked: — the location in proximity of mid-town manhattan is a hassle

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A great modern hotel with a fantastic quiet location overlooking the Hudson River & Manhatton. Our bedroom was on the 8th Floor with a view of the Hudson, Manhatton & the Statue of Liberty in the distance. The bedroom was clean, air conditioned, a good size & comfortably furnished. Very comfy beds, clean towels every day, coffee maker, TV etc. The Hotel Staff were very friendly, attentive & helpful. The Hotel's Vu Restaurant served a good if slightly expensive breakfast/dinner. There are other restaurants nearby. The Path Rail is right next door - 4 mins to the World Trade Centre Station where you can catch the subway if needed. There's also a ferry 5 mins away from the Hotel, catch it to Pier 11 for the Seaport Shops & entertainment. Also a block away is the light railway which has a stop at the Newport Shopping Mall. We loved this Hotel & plan to return soon.
reviews.title: 2 stars maybe!

likes.disliked: — lack of expected amenities ; $32 to park a car per night

reviews.text: My boyfriend and I (we are in our early 30s) stayed at this hotel from Nov. 15-17th. We stayed in room 663, non smoking, King size bed.
reviews.title: Dont get a level ONE or EIGHT Room!
Excellent property, but execution needs fine tuning
reviews.text: I won't hesitate to return, but there are a few things that need addressing. The property itself is what you would expect from a Hyatt, for the most part. The staff was excellent, and they upgraded me to a king room with a panoramic view of Manhattan, which was excellent. The room and furnishings were clean, quiet, and very comfortable. The fitness center was also very good. However, the lack of HDTV was remarkable, especially when every Hyatt Place I've visited is fully HDTV. Finally, despite an excellent rating, the restaurant (Vu) was empty and almost unedible. I will review it separately. With the PATH connection closely, it is an excellent property in which to stay if you don't want pay Manhattan prices.
I've been staying here quite often for eight years now.
reviews.title: vegetables please

reviews.text: The hotel sits perfectly on the Hudson with a good view over Manhattan and even the statue of liberty. Every morning after a short workout in the small but functional gym, I enjoy the buffet breakfast. So I know what I'm talking about;-)
reviews.title: A great NYC stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fix this and I will happily give you the fifth point:
reviews.title: Nice stay

reviews.text: Warm and hot breakfast has no vegetables whatsoever. Please add tomatoes, salsa or something green.
reviews.title: Will stay here again on our next visit to NYC

reviews.text: Arrived late on Thursday 1st to be told the hotel was overbooked and our rooms were not available.
reviews.title: Very good after a poor start

likes.liked: — The Views and the friendly of the staff

reviews.text: They were blaming it on problems with Hyatt central reservations although we had booked direct with the hotel in July.
reviews.title: It's the view that does it!

reviews.text: We were transported to a Hyatt hotel in Seacaucus/Meadowlands.
reviews.title: Perfect stay for NY City trip.

likes.disliked: — Small pool. No free internet access.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Accommodation here was excellent and paid for by Hyatt so we were only charged for 3 nights accommodation at the regency.
reviews.title: Convenient to NYC and a great value!
Hyatt Stay
reviews.text: We arranged a pick up to take us back to the Regency next morning at 8 am.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I enjoyed our stay at this hotel mostly because - as many have mentioned - the views from the lobby, Vu Restaurant, bar and most of the rooms are stunning! The way the light catches the buildings and water throughout the day and evening has you reaching for your camera every 2 minutes. We had a corner room with 3 windows which gave us a good view of midtown Manhattan. The room was large with a huge king bed, L shaped desk, fridge (not a mini bar) and a large TV (but not flat screen). Bathroom was large with a tub and shower over it. Everything was exceptionally clean and well maintained - a typical glossy Hyatt bathroom and understated, muted colours used throughout
reviews.title: Nice with a few glitches

likes.liked: — The views and the PATH convenience
likes.disliked: — Check in employee and their refusal to help me

reviews.text: We had breakfast (the standard buffet) in the Vu restaurant - it was an elegant but relaxed affair which we both really enjoyed - the selection of food is good and the service was friendly but unobtrusive. I think the price was about $23 each - compared to London hotel prices this is a bargain...The restaurant itself is light and airy - a memorable setting for a meal.
reviews.title: Will be staying here again

likes.disliked: — Valet a bit expensive, but expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If I had one issue with the hotel it would have to be the reception staff. We admittedly arrived early and I did not expect a room to be ready by 11.00am. So I pre registered, as requested. The man told us to come back at 2.00pm when the room would definitely be ready. We got back at 2.00pm to be told (different person) that check in was at 4.00pm and there were people "still in the room". There was also "no guarantee that it would be ready by 4.00pm" either. The way this info was delivered was off hand and unfriendly - a "take it or leave it" attitude said without apology or charm. When I said that I had been asked by her colleague to return at 2.00pm she merely shrugged her shoulders and put her head down. This wasn't a good start and it definitely gave a poor first impression. We decided to go back into Manhattan and returned around 5.30pm. We were then given our room. It wasn't a great check in experience.
reviews.title: My New Favoriye Hotel for NYC

likes.disliked: — Room safe too small for laptop; the $6 in-room bottled water

reviews.text: We were also given a room on the NW when our reservation stated we'd been allocated a room on the NE. Not a tragedy as the view was still good but not what was booked which for us was disappointing. The check in & room experience experience stops me giving the hotel top marks
reviews.title: LOW LOW LOW Price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The JC Hyatt was definately a great place to stay. Alot of people say it's better to stay downtown NYC, but I wouldn't. The prices here are cheaper, it's easy access to NYC, and best of all you don't have to worry about the NYC traffic.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.text: This hotel is in a great location in terms of view but a lousy location in terms of traffic and also in terms of amenities. When I checked in for this business trip, I called down the front desk to see if I could have my suit pressed. "We're sorry sir. We don't have that 'capability' on site." What? Really? Nobody that can press a suit? Well, that's OK. I have a suite overlooking the Hudson with a beautiful view of the city skyline in the background. The only issue is that the walls are paper thin in this hotel. You can literally hear your neighbors rolling their curtains down at night and you can hear them in the restroom. Even with earplugs I awoke several times to the sound of carts and service people rolling by in the hallway. I might have just had a particularly loud person next door but I could probably hear them better than one of those "Can you hear me now?" commercials. I haven't stayed in a Hyatt for sometime because my last stay at their Carmel, CA property was one where the valet had parked my car into a rock (breaking the fog light on my new SL Mercedes) and then they woke us up several times to try to sell us timeshares that would offer us a stay in a suite (that we were already staying in at full-rate). The Hyatt experience is just not a good one. I waited 25 minutes today after calling down to get my car from the valet because they were busy. Well, I know things get busy but at lunch rush, why only have one valet working? Is that normal?
reviews.title: Not bad. Not good. Just Hyatt.

reviews.text: Tonight, I seriously thought about just giving it one more try and booking a night away at the Hyatt Avia Napa (I arrive back in SFO tomorrow) but the Hyatt online reservation system went down for maintenance and the room I had just hit 'confirm' on was sold to someone 'on property' according to that hotel at that same moment. No apologies, no alternatives, just bad luck on my part.
reviews.title: Great Place to stay!

reviews.text: I think sometimes we make our own luck and I've never had luck worse than when staying at a Hyatt. This is the last one and it wasn't horrible but I'm getting out of here before it gets worse. ;-)
reviews.title: Great Views but holes in service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife, three kids, and I stayed from 6/15/12-6/17/12. The staff was friendly, and very accommodating to our requests for extra towels, and sheets. The room was very clean. The king bed was extremely comfortable! The location was great as the PATH system was next door. The hotel restaurant was well designed with great views, and the staff was very polite, and even moved us to a better table when one became available! The only problem we encountered was during checkout, 20 minutes prior to departure I requested my car be brought to the front of the building and a bell boy come to bring our bags down. The bell boy was prompt, but we waited 30 minutes for the car only to find out that they forgot to send the request to bring my car. Overall 5/5 stay, and service.
reviews.title: Great view!

reviews.text: We attended a wedding recently at the Hyatt. Arrived at 4PM only to be told the room wouldn't be ready for another hour. (Check in is supposed to be 3 PM). Not nice since the wedding was to commence at 6. A few other wedding guests were also cooling their heels in the lobby waiting for their rooms. Our plan was to get into our room at 4 to dress at our leisure, then go downstairs and have a cocktail with our friends before the ceremony. Once in our room, we had to quickly wash and dress, Putting on a tux and a gown isn't something you can do in five minutes. We arrived at the ceremony at 6. Obviously, they are having problems with the housekeeping management.
reviews.title: Wonderful view

reviews.text: I was very impressed with Hyatt Jersey City . Although Hyatts are generaly held to a higher level that many other hotels , I would have to say that this Hyatt exceeded my expectations. The service is top notch. From the bellman to, to check-in, to housekeeping, and the lounge. They are all very polite and attentive. A rarity in the tri-state area these days. The bed was wonderful and the room was very clean with just enough space. The bathrooms are large, clean and come with plenty of amenities. We payed the lowest rate, yet still had a room with a very nice view on NYC. The Empire State Building was in clear view. I never got to try the breakfast buffet, but it looked very nice. The rest. and lounge area offers very nice views. I would highly rec. this hotel not only for business travelers, but also people visiting NYC. The weekend rates are much less then lower Manhattan, and the path train is right outside. You can make it from the Hyatt front door to lower Manhattan in less then 10 mins.
reviews.title: Impressive
Great Hotel
reviews.text: Great Hotel! Stayed here for my first trip to NYC. Hotel was much cheaper than hotels in the city, but just as convenient. It was fairly easy to get to off the NJ turnpike, and had easy access to Manhattan. The PATH subway is right at the front door and is a 5 minute ride to the World Trade Center. Ferries nearby will take you to midtown Manhattan, the statue of liberty and other points. The hotel is right on the Hudson River, and our room had a wonderful view of the Manhattan skyline. There was a nice exercise room, and a great heated pool. The staff was courteous and helpful, and the hotel was very clean.

reviews.title: Hidden Gem for exploring New York
reviews.text: The only negatives were that the parking was very expensive ($30 a day) as was the restaurant/bar at the hotel. We ate all of our meals out. The Jersey City area seems a little run down but the immediate area around the hotel is clean and seemed safe. I would definitely stay again, and would recommend this hotel to others.
We got an excellent deal for staying at the Hyatt, and it was cheaper than
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.text: staying in most of the hotels in New York itself.
reviews.title: Great hotel, reasonably-priced and very convenient for sightseeing

reviews.text: I recently spent 2 nights here and attended a conference. The room was great, nice and clean, big, great shower. They had everything i needed: an iron, hair dryer, safe. The fitness center was also great, nice machines in good condition, plenty of towels, drinking water and a bathroom. They even have medicine balls and jump ropes.
reviews.title: Great view, easy access to Manhattan, clean, great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The view of Manhattan was great. The only issue I had was that they were unable to provide me with a vegetarian lunch on the second day of the conference so i left the hotel and went to a sandwich shop.
reviews.title: Comfortable, reasonably priced, and 5 min train to Manhattan.

reviews.text: I also visited the Vu lounge and had a pleasant experience including a nice glass of wine.
reviews.title: Service second to none

reviews.text: I will highly recommend this Hyatt to my friends and co-workers in FL as a good alternative to staying in Manhattan. The city is easily accessible by train or boat (7 minutes to Wall Street) the view of the Manhattan skyline is wonderful and the area feels safe with nice place to take a walk.
reviews.title: Excellent Views!

reviews.text: We were travelling around the winter holidays, when most hotels in Manhattan were posting a $400+ price tag per night for any reasonably-nice accomodations. This hotel is in NJ just across the river, offers breathtaking views of the Manhattan skyline, and is directly across the street from the Path train stop, which takes you into downtown Manhattan (financial district) in 5 minutes. We found that very convenient. We had breakfast at the hotel restarant overlooking the river, which was also very nice (options of buffet and a la carte items). Downside was a relatively small gym/pool area without dedicated showers.
reviews.title: Nice hotel great location

reviews.text: Very professional staff. Ana was very welcoming during check in and so were the rest of the staff.
reviews.title: Great views, convenient, great location for public transportation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was clean, large and convenient with everything required.
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.text: Shower stream was a bit disappointing but not critical.
reviews.title: The most spectacular view of NYC

reviews.text: The views from the room and lobby are amazing (see the picture at sunrise). Location is great as well, close to Newport mall (5 min by light train that is a min walk from hotel), a minute walk to PATH train to NY city (WTC station).
reviews.title: Wow, what a view !

reviews.text: Overall very good experience would return for business trips again.
reviews.title: An A+ for service and views!!!

reviews.text: My boyfriend and I had planned a weekend in NYC, with theater, sight-seeing, etc. for October 14-16. The hotels in Manhattan were outrageous ($250 and up) per night, so we looked into Jersey City, where we had stayed before at the Doubletree (longer walk to the PATH). The Hyatt Regency Jersey City looked like a great location, so we inquired into rates.
reviews.title: Weekend Escape! Great Value!

reviews.text: For the weekend, we were able to book (at Hyatt) a rate of $107, which is about $120 per night including taxes. Great rate! And as others have said, the PATH station is literally 50 feet from the front of the hotel.
reviews.title: Wonderful...
Not worth the money
reviews.text: The hotel is basically on a pier out in the New Jersey side of the Hudson River. All sides of the hotel have some sort of a Manhattan view. We were in room #619, which had an awesome view facing north, and could see most of mid-town Manhattan. If only the weather was better!

The room was clean, comfortable, and all hotel staff were helpful and friendly. We self-parked in a garage 2 blocks away the 1st night ($15 with front-desk validation), and then we moved the car to the street for free parking the 2nd night. Just be sure to read the street signs and meters for the hours and rules!
reviews.title: Nice room, great views, desolate on the weekend
Dissatisfied customer, noisy environment
reviews.text: We did not use any other facilities of the hotel...we were having too much fun enjoying NYC! It's an easy PATH ride to the World Trade Center area, and then you can easily transfer to the NYC Subway for the rest of NYC. The subways make it so easy (and cheap!) to get around!

reviews.title: repeat customer, this time a disappointment
reviews.text: I discovered the Jersey City Hyatt early in 2004 and have since been staying at the for all my trips to New York. Never the least bit disappointed... until now.

A big plus for this hotel is the price difference on this side of the Hudson. The hotel sits literally on the water and is steps away from the Exchange Place PATH station. If I time the trains right, I can get to Manhattan in 5 minutes, transfer to the subway and go wherever in NYC and get whatever I need. I always buy a 11 or 20-ride PATH Quickcard, so each trip across the Hudson is only $1.36 or $1.20 - respectively (the quickcards remain valid for 6 months). Thusfar, I've never had any problems with the hotel itself. The hotel has always put me on the 5th floor or above - always quiet (and w/o the street noises of Manhattan).
reviews.title: Good experience

reviews.text: On this occasion, the hotel put me in room 220 which I have discovered, is directly beneath the hotel bar. No problems at all with noise. But, at 12:30am, a significant amount of water began leaking from the ceiling, as I hear water running above at the bar. Fortunately, the leak is not above my bed, but my luggage happened to be sitting beneath the leak. I quickly moved my suitcase out of the way, so no big deal. I place all my towels on the floor to soak up water and garbage cans to help collect the water. I then packed up all my luggage and prepared to move to another room. All the hotel had was a smoking room (not acceptable) so I remained in 220. The bar is done cleaning up, so the leaking has stopped for now. But it has leaving a large, wet area of carpet. All in all, this incident is a big disappointment.
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.text: As well, I drove here this time - I normally take the train (very convenient, but increasingly expensive). I heeded the advice of other reviewers, and opted for self parking. The staff was very unclear in directing me to the self parking. After circling around the area for a half-hour, I found it and it is very convenient. If you walk out of the hotel, cross the light rail line, continue past the parking lot to Greene St. The parking garage entrance is on the right-side, on the corner. You take the parking card from the garage to the hotel desk, and they're supposed to place a sticker on it (for the self-parking rate). The parking garage is open 24x7. On Sundays, street parking is also an option.
reviews.title: Hotel Purgatory

reviews.text: I don’t know how common this leaking problem is at the Hyatt. I have enjoyed staying here on many occasions in the past. I'm sorry to have to be so harsh in my review, as my previous stays have been perfect. But, next time I'm in New York, I might just swallow the higher prices of Manhattan and avoid the Jersey City Hyatt. If saving $$$ is really important to you, this hotel might be okay.
reviews.title: Nice stay at Hyatt

reviews.text: Better than staying in Manhattan, honestly. MUCH better views of the City. In Manhattan, mostly you just look at another building from your room. But here, you get the whole skyline. Our view was of mid-town.
reviews.title: Loved this Hyatt..Great Location

reviews.text: VERY safe location in Jersey City..you almost feel like you are staying in Lower Manhattan's financial district. We saw joggers everywhere..day and night.
reviews.title: Excellent: Great Service, Best View of Lower Manhattan
Hyatt on Hudson--awesome view of NY
reviews.text: Room was very nice...coffee maker, desk, 2 dbl beds...VERY quiet. Never heard a sound from hallway/rooms next door.

reviews.title: Great Views, Quiet Weekend Location
reviews.text: We had our 8-yr old with us and we always felt VERY safe walking around outside. The PATH subway system is literally 10 steps from the lobby. Within 2 minutes you are at Ground Zero. And if you want to connect to a NYC train, you don't even have to leave the station..just follow the signs after you exit the PATH train in Lower Manhattan to your connecting train.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is built on a pier on the Hudson River across from World Trade Center. The location is fantastic, peaceful and the view is spectacular. To see Freedom Tower lit in red-white-blue at night was breathtaking. I took a basic room and the view from there was just ok because it was partially blocked. The room was clean, comfortable and had good décor. The lounge has a great view. The drinks and food are excellent, but they were understaffed both times we went. They gave us a free round of drinks both times to compensate for it. I would return.
reviews.title: Great Jersey Stay - Stunning View of NYC

reviews.text: The rooms are spaceous and for the most, clean. I've found hairs in the bathroom a few times, leading me to complain to management about this ongoing issue. However the staff are always kind to react swiftly without Any problems. The breakfast is good, offering a Nice variety of healthy as Well as sinful treats. The staff are immaculate and i always feel welcome. I Am a frequent visitor, I just wish they Would pay more attention to cleaning the bathroom properly. Because it is a really Nice hotel with a good ambience.
reviews.title: Great location and views towards Manhattan skyline

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everyone knows a great view, Empire State, Top of the Rock, Essex House, etc. If you want the very best view of the Manhattan skyline, I mean undisputed-blow your socks off- you'll have to go to New Jersey. I'm not kidding.
reviews.title: Best view of New York City...
Amazing view
reviews.text: There are other rooms plenty of rooms at the Hyatt in Jersey City. However, only two have balconies. If you are on a budget the smaller room is still $400+ with a balcony. If you can afford the $3000 per night for the Empire Room it is worth every penny. In fact, thirty of your friends could join you on your balcony and everyone would agree at the "Awesomeness" of the room.

The Hyatt is a very nice hotel with great service. The food is excellent and the restaurant offers several gluten free options. The Empire Room has a great bar and dining room. The view...the view...it's all about the view. Night, morning, it's all fabulous.
reviews.title: Amazing experience

description: Opened in July 2002, the Hyatt Regency Jersey City reflects Jersey City’s cultural renaissance and increasing value as a premier business center. Located in the heart of “Wall Street West” and just minutes away from New York City, this stunning property offers you the perfect venue for your corporate affairs while benefiting from the most remarkable skyline views Manhattan has to offer. Our full-service luxury hotel embodies the most modern elegance, unparalleled culinary experience, and outstanding service. Offering over 20,000 square feet of function space and 351 deluxe guestrooms with breathtaking views of Manhattan, the Hyatt Regency is the quintessential event location. The hotel is easily accessible by cab, ferry, or the PATH and is just a short ride away from Manhattan. Hyatt Regency Jersey City offers a combination of style and excellence that make for a truly memorable experience.
